content: Create a script for an interview on The Ellen DeGeneres Show with Leonardo DiCaprio discussing his acting career.

**[INTRO MUSIC FADES IN]**

**Ellen DeGeneres:** [Cheerfully] Welcome back to the show! I am so excited for our next guest. He's an incredible actor, environmental activist, and all-around amazing human being. Please welcome the one and only Leonardo DiCaprio!

**[APPLAUSE AS LEONARDO ENTERS THE STAGE, SMILING AND WAVING]**

**Leonardo DiCaprio:** [Grinning] Thanks for having me, Ellen. It's great to be here.

**Ellen:** Oh, it's always a pleasure to have you. Now, Leo, you've had such an incredible career. From "Titanic" to "The Revenant," you've really shown your versatility as an actor. So, let's start at the beginning. How did you get into acting?

**Leonardo:** Well, Ellen, I grew up in Los Angeles, so the entertainment industry was always around me. I started doing commercials when I was just a kid, like many others in LA. But I think what really sparked my interest was being on set and seeing how stories come to life. I was about 12 when I landed my first big role in "Critters 3," but it was really "This Boy's Life" that kicked off my serious acting career.

**Ellen:** That's so interesting. And then, of course, "Titanic" came along and changed everything. Can you believe that movie is over 20 years old now?

**Leonardo:** [Laughs] It's hard to believe, isn't it? Time flies when you're sinking ships [chuckles]. "Titanic" was a monumental experience for me. It was my first big blockbuster, and it exposed me to a whole new level of filmmaking and global audience.

**Ellen:** Speaking of blockbusters, you've been in some pretty huge movies. But you've also taken on smaller, more independent films. What draws you to a project?

**Leonardo:** For me, it's always about the story and the characters. I want to be challenged as an actor, and I think that comes from diving into roles that are complex and multidimensional. Whether it's a big-budget film or an indie gem, if the script is compelling and the team is passionate, I'm interested.

**Ellen:** That's fantastic. And you've worked with some of the best directors out there—Martin Scorsese, Quentin Tarantino, James Cameron. Any favorite collaborations?

**Leonardo:** Oh, all of them have been incredible experiences in their own right. Working with Martin Scorsese on films like "The Departed" and "The Wolf of Wall Street" has been particularly profound. His attention to detail and passion for storytelling are unmatched. Quentin Tarantino brings a unique energy to set, and collaborating with him on "Django Unchained" was a blast. And, of course, James Cameron is a visionary director who pushes the boundaries of filmmaking technology.

**Ellen:** Absolutely. Now, switching gears a bit, you're not just known for your acting; you're also a prominent environmental activist. How did you get involved in that cause?

**Leonardo:** I've always had a deep connection to nature, growing up near the beach in L.A. But it was really in the late '90s when I started traveling the world for film productions that I began to see the impact of climate change firsthand. I saw deforestation, melting glaciers, and other environmental degradation. It became clear that this was an urgent issue that needed attention, and I felt compelled to do something about it.

**Ellen:** And you've certainly done a lot. You've produced documentaries, founded the Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation, and even won a联合国环保最高荣誉——地球卫士奖。你觉得作为一个公众人物，你在环保方面的角色是什么？

**Leonardo:** 我认为作为公众人物，有责任利用我的平台来提高人们对环境问题的认识，并激励他人采取行动。通过制作纪录片如《11th Hour》、《The 11th Hour》和《Before the Flood》，以及成立莱昂纳多·迪卡普里奥基金会，我们能够资助和支持那些在一线工作的组织和项目，他们致力于保护地球的自然资源和生物多样性。

**Ellen:** 那真是太棒了。你的基金会做了很多重要的工作。最近有什么特别的项目或成就你想和我们分享的吗？

**Leonardo:** 当然，我们的基金会一直在努力支持各种环保倡议。最近，我们重点关注海洋保护、森林保护和气候解决方案。例如，我们在全球范围内支持珊瑚礁的恢复工作，因为它们是地球上一些最脆弱的生态系统之一。此外，我们还投资于可再生能源项目，以帮助减少温室气体排放。

**Ellen:** 这些都是至关重要的工作。我希望更多的人能了解到这些努力，并加入到保护我们星球的行动中来。现在，让我们谈回你的演艺事业。你最近参演了《不要抬头》，与亚当·德赖弗和梅琳达·克拉克合作。能和我们谈谈这部电影吗？

**Leonardo:** 《不要抬头》是一部非常有趣的黑色喜剧，由亚当·麦凯执导。我在片中饰演一位天文学家，和亚当·德赖弗一起发现了一颗即将撞击地球的彗星。电影探讨了人们如何应对迫在眉睫的灾难，以及媒体和政客如何处理这样的危机。它既幽默又发人深省，我相信观众会喜欢的。

**Ellen:** 听起来很吸引人。我迫不及待想要看了。另外，我听说你还在筹备一些新项目，能不能给我们透露一点消息？

**Leonardo:** 嗯，我总是有很多项目在进行中，但具体细节我不能透露太多。不过，我可以告诉你们，我一直在寻找能够激发我兴趣和挑战我的角色。无论是戏剧性的、喜剧性的还是纪录片式的，只要是好的故事，我都愿意尝试。

**Ellen:** 我相信你的粉丝们都期待着看到你的新作品。在我们结束之前，我想问一下，你有什么想对你的粉丝说的吗？

**Leonardo:** 首先，我要感谢所有支持我的粉丝。没有你们的支持，我无法走到今天。请继续关注环境保护，因为这是我们所有人共同的责任。同时，我也鼓励大家追求自己的激情和梦想，不要害怕挑战和失败。记住，每一次尝试都是成长的机会。

**Ellen:** 说得太好了，Leo。感谢你今天来到节目，与我们分享你的故事和见解。

**Leonardo:** 谢谢你，Ellen。和你聊天总是很愉快。

**[APPLAUSE AS THEY CONCLUDE THE INTERVIEW]**

**[OUTRO MUSIC FADES IN]**

**Ellen:** Don't forget to check out Leonardo's latest projects and support his环保工作。我们下次节目再见！

**[END OF INTERVIEW]**
